intro: Eupomatia barbata, commonly known as the hairy eupomatia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Eupomatia barbata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
